title: The German government announces the launch of a research & production facility for industrial scale lithium-ion cell manufacturing
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Germany.

Capacity:
- The Battery Cell Research Production Centre is planned to have a capacity of 1 GWh per year by 2020.

Investment amounts:
- The project will receive an investment of 500 million Euros from the German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF).

Project progress:
- Leclanché announced in December 2018 that it would triple the current factory capacity to over 3 million cells per year, or 1 GWh per year by 2020. The production of its proprietary cells, Lithium Titanate Oxide (LT) and Lithium Graphite/NMC, is based in Willstätt, Germany, which is currently the largest lithium-ion pouch cell production facility in Europe operating since 2012 with a capacity of over 1 million cells.

Project type:
- The project is an expansion of the current factory capacity.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cell fabrication, as it will support the development of mass industrial production based on state-of-the-art cell chemistry and cell design.

title: Leclanché lands fresh funding in bid to treble cell manufacturing capacity
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Willstätt, Germany.

Capacity:
- The planned capacity of the project is set to be increased, with a planned uptick in battery cell manufacturing capacity at the plant in Willstätt, Germany. The specific GW capacity is not provided.

Investment amounts:
- Leclanché has secured a CHF39 million (US$40 million) unsecured convertible loan facility with New Jersey-based Yorkville Advisors. Additionally, a CHF25 million (US$25.4 million) working capital financing convertible facility has been provided by majority shareholder FEFAM. In total, Leclanché has raised around CHF64 million (US$65 million) in growth funding.

Project progress:
- The project has been gradually ramping up its facility's output since 2009, with a one million lithium-ion cell production line installed in 2012 and further ramped up in 2013. The recent investment is aimed at financing a planned expansion of the plant's capacity.

Project type:
- The project is an expansion at an existing battery site in Willstätt, Germany.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers cell fabrication, as it has been producing lithium-ion cells and other chemistry cells.

Note: Specific details on the current operational capacity and subsidies received are not provided in the given information.

title: Leclanché secures $65 million investment to triple battery making capacity in Europe
notes:
Location: Germany
Capacity: The project will triple the volume of cells manufactured in Germany to three million cells.
Investment amounts: CHF64 million ($65 million) in total, including CHF39 million ($40 million) from US-based Yorkville Advisors Global and CHF25 million from FEFAM, the company's largest shareholder.
Project progress: The investment will allow Leclancé to triple its manufacturing capacity at its German plant and fund the delivery of the company’s order book.
Project type: Expansion at an existing battery site.
Value chain stages: The facility covers cell fabrication.

notes:
Location:

Capacity:

Investment amounts:

Project progress:
